page.title: 08ENTERTAINMENT IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: Entertainment tends to be home based. This is partly because the buses and coaches do not run in the evening. Watching television and video films and listening to the radio are very popular.Video films can be recorded using special equipment and a television,or they can be hired from shops in the local towns or from mobile video libraries.Occasionally people travel to Kings Lynn to visit the theatre or the cinema.However this tends to be quite expensive - it would cost a family of two adults and two children in the region of Â£12-Â£13 for transport and entrance. Villagers make use of the local clubs in the evenings including the social club which has a licensed bar. Unfortunately the village no longer has a public house, although there used to be five.
